Explosions in Zaporizhzhia. These are the second strikes so far.

KABs are being launched from the area of Molochansk and Kalynivka from Su-34s at medium altitudes, flying along the vectors shown on the map. 
Impacts are recorded in Rozumivka/Nyzhnya Khortytsya, just outside Zaporizhzhia City.

Russian forces have crossed the Haichur River northwest of Hulyaipole and entered the treelines on its western bank, officially marking the start of the battles for Zaporizhzhia Raion (District).
Zaporizhzhia Raion was the second to last non-contested district in the 4 Oblasts claimed by Russia, and the last district that Russia never entered in the first place. Now only Beryslav Raion in Kherson Oblast remains.

Russian forces have crossed the Haichur River northwest of Hulyaipole and entered the treelines on its western bank, officially marking the start of the battles for Zaporizhzhia Raion (District).
Zaporizhzhia Raion was the second to last non-contested district in the 4 Oblasts claimed by Russia, and the last district that Russia never entered in the first place. Now only Beryslav Raion in Kherson Oblast remains.

The air raid alerts in Odesa Oblast have been ongoing for over 10 hours. 
This is the third consecutive day of large-scale attacks on energy, gas, and port infrastructure, as well as on other targets in the region.

Ukrainian HIMARS rockets have once again targeted the Belgorod Power Plant in Belgorod City. A large fire was seen burning following the impacts.
Coordinates: 50.59935, 36.61694

Ukrainian HIMARS rockets have once again targeted the Belgorod Power Plant in Belgorod City. A large fire was seen burning following the impacts.
Coordinates: 50.59935, 36.61694

Overnight, Russian Geran-2 drones once again attacked targets in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
At least 12 Gerans targeted the railway junction in the city of Pyatykhatky (48.41386, 33.69432). Media 2 shows some of the damage from the blast waves. 
At least 10 Gerans struck an unknown target in the village of Khoroshe.
At least 4 Gerans targeted the "Svitlo Shakhtarya" 150 kV electrical substation at the Stepnaya Mine near the city of Shakhtarske (48.37662, 36.36671). Media 1 shows one of the impacts and media 3 shows a fire burning afterwards.

At least 12 Gerans targeted the railway junction in the city of Pyatykhatky (48.41386, 33.69432). Media 2 shows some of the damage from the blast waves.

In the Dobropillya direction, Russian forces continued to advance, making more progress in and around Myrnohrad.
In the southeast, Russian forces continued advancing north towards Myrnohrad city centre and captured the rest of the 3-story buildings. Fighting is now ongoing for the City Central Hospital and the adjacent row of apartment buildings. Russian forces also advanced further northwest and linked up with assault groups in the northwestern streets of the city, while other forces cleared the remaining pockets of Ukrainian resistance in the treelines to the southwest. Additionally, the Russians reached the city centre from the east, advancing from the area of the paintball field to the stadium, capturing additional low-rise residential areas there.
To the northwest, Russian forces continued advancing east through Svitle and have captured most of the rest of the village. They also managed to consolidate in the former Novator Mine, fully securing the northern outskirts of Myrnohrad.
To the west, Russian forces continued their assault operations north of Pokrovsk and captured new positions in two different treelines, including one along the road to Hryshyne. 
+ ~6.86 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Russia is currently completing its preparations for the next large-scale, combined missile and drone attack on Ukraine. 
- At least 3 Tu-95MS strategic bombers are redeploying from Ukrainka Airbase, Amur Oblast, to Engels-2 Airbase, Saratov Oblast after being equipped with Kh-101 cruise missiles.
- 1 Tu-95MS has been equipped with Kh-101 missiles at Engels-2 Airbase.
- 3 Tu-160 strategic bombers have been equipped with Kh-101 missiles at Ukrainka Airbase. They will likely take part in the attack by flying from the far east to the launch lines.
- 4-6 MiG-31K fighters have been equipped with Kinzhal hypersonic aeroballistic missiles at Savasleika Airbase, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast.
- Iskander-M ballistic missiles have been delivered to OTRK installations in Kursk Oblast, Bryansk Oblast, Voronezh Oblast, and Rostov Oblast.
- Iskander-K cruise missiles have been delivered to OTRK installations in Kursk Oblast and Voronezh Oblast.
- Accumulation of Geran-2 and Gerbera drones has been ongoing at all major launch points surrounding Ukraine, with more than 500 ready for use.
- There is no confirmed information about the possible usage of Kalibrs during this upcoming attack, however this is not ruled out.
The highest threat is for the night/morning of Tuesday/Wednesday; however, it could take place at any of the next 3 nights/mornings, including tonight. 
Energy infrastructure in the western regions (especially Ivano-Frankivsk and Lviv Oblasts) and Kyiv Oblast are the most likely targets.

Russia is currently completing its preparations for the next large-scale, combined missile and drone attack on Ukraine.   - At least 3 Tu-95MS strategic bombers are redeploying from Ukrainka Airbase, Amur Oblast, to Engels-2 Airbase, Saratov Oblast after being‚Ä¶
* This is not a complete list of activity. Changes will be made, some things listed here may be being prepared for something else. This is meant to serve as a minimum for current, confirmed activity.

Deepstate has officially joined the linear warfare bros. 
Pressure from the SBU must be high.

6 Grom-E1 rocket-powered glide-bombs and at least 18 Geran-2 drones targeted the Zatoka Bridge in Odesa Oblast. All of the glide-bombs and most of the drones impacted.  Coordinates: 46.07611, 30.46972

Footage showing yesterday's combined glide-bomb and Geran-2 drone attack on the Zatoka railway and road bridge in Odesa Oblast.
This bridge is the only connector in Ukraine between southern Odesa Oblast and the rest of the country.

In the Rai-Oleksandrivka direction, Russian forces continued to advance in several different areas, exploiting the fall of Siversk to make additional progress. 
In the southeast, following the fall of Siversk and the withdrawal of Ukrainian formations from positions northwest of the city, Russian forces began a two-axis push further west along the tactical heights. They were able to quickly capture the remaining positions north of the Siversk - Lyman highway and began advancing south down the treelines to the rear of the chalk quarry. 
Other forces advanced directly west from Siversk, capturing the trenches just outside the city and quickly entering the chalk quarry from the east. Ukrainian units continued to withdraw further west, while covering Siversk itself with FPV drones in an attempt to disrupt Russian logistics and slow their advance. Since then, the Russians have continued to push west along the tactical heights and occupied new positions in the forest plantations and treelines further west, almost levelling the frontline between Platonivka and Sviato-Pokrovske. Additionally, they were able to complete the capture of Sviato-Pokrovske - establishing control over its western outskirts - and are now engaged in battles for the eastern outskirts of Riznykivka.
To the northwest, Russian forces advanced from the strongpoints along the highway and entered the first houses of Ozerne, capturing its northern street. Further west, other forces broke through to the northern bank of the Siverskyi Donets River and entrenched in the northwestern-most houses of Ozerne. 
In the northwest, Russian forces continued to expand their zone of control in Dibrova and managed to fully capture the eastern half of the village. Other forces continued slowly advancing through the forests to the north, capturing additional positions southwest and west of the lakes.
+ ~15.43 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Rai-Oleksandrivka direction and on the northeastern flank of Kostyantynivka, Russian forces continued their intensified assault operations and have made significant progress over the past week.
In the southwest, following their earlier infiltrations, Russian forces managed to consolidate in the treelines north of Virolyubivka and in the forest on the eastern bank of the reservoir east of Klynove. They then entered Virolyubivka and established control over the northern part of the village. Additionally, under heavy artillery and MLRS cover, Russian forces began a new push north from Maiske in the direction of Markove - Fedorivka, and managed to consolidate in new treeline positions north of Maiske and the forest to the northwest. Some soldiers have infiltrated further, entering the western houses of Markove and reaching the forest plantations to the west.
In the northeast, Russian forces began advancing southwest from Vasyukivka. They captured new positions in five different treelines and some adjacent forested areas and are threatening to cut off some of the last remaining 2023 fortifications in this sector.  Additionally, the Russians managed to eliminate part of the salient north of Vasyukivka, consolidating in the trenches there, and began a new push further north. There, theyy were able to capture the village of Pazeno and advanced up two treelines, reaching and establishing control over a large part of the forest to the north.
+ ~20.81 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Russia and Ukraine Exchange Strikes on Energy and Oil & Gas Facilities
On the night of December 13-14, Russian and Ukrainian forces conducted mutual strikes. The Russian attack, which included a ballistic missile and over 130 strike drones, was primarily aimed at Ukraine's Odesa region. Russian forces carried out a second consecutive massive strike on the region's energy sector. Facilities of energy, transport and industrial infrastructure were damaged. Numerous hits were reported in the village of Sarata, Bilhorod-Dnistrovskyi district.
The Ukrainian Navy accused the Russian Armed Forces of attacking the Turkish vessel "VIVA," which was sailing with sunflower oil under the flag of Tuvalu from Ukraine to Egypt. Russian and Turkish authorities have not yet confirmed the incident.
In turn, Ukrainian forces launched over 235 drones at targets in several Russian regions, including power stations, oil depots, and oil refineries.
üëâ

Military Situation In Northern Palestine On December 14, 2025 (Map Update)

Myrnohrad Cauldron: Military Failure and Humanitarian Catastrophe in Testimonies of Captured Ukrainian Soldiers
Russian troops continue clearing the so-called "Myrnohrad cauldron" in the Pokrovsk direction, where, according to various estimates, hundreds of Ukrainian Armed Forces (AFU) servicemen are encircled. The operation is proceeding methodically: after clearing the southern part of Myrnohrad, combat operations have shifted to the city's center and north.
Testimonies from Ukrainian servicemen who surrendered in this area paint a picture of chaos, disorganization, and brutal pragmatism on the part of the command. According to the prisoners, their units were tasked with storming Russian positions and were subsequently effectively abandoned.
"We were sitting in the basement and hiding," stated one prisoner. Another confirmed receiving an order to "go silent and await further instructions," which under conditions of total encirclement is tantamount to a death sentence.
üëâ

Russian Forces Complete Myrnohrad Operation: Urban Clashes in City Center, Ukrainian Counterattacks at Hrishyne Repelled
On the Pokrovsk sector, Russian units are concluding operations in Myrnohrad, with assault groups arriving from the north and east. On the Zaporizhzhia sector, the Russian army has taken control of Varvarivka, positioning itself to establish a bridgehead beyond the Haichur River. Meanwhile, Italian Deputy Prime Minister Matteo Salvini has spoken out against conflict with Russia.

A Grim Fate For Foreign Contractors: Chasing Money Ends In Injury And Death
The number of foreign mercenaries killed in Ukraine continues to grow. New "bounty hunters" have been identified, and their fate has proven to be extremely unfortunate. Despite this terrible reality, the flow of people looking to make money is not slowing down.
One of the West's strengths is its highly developed and effective propaganda apparatus. Skillful public relations campaigns in the media and on social networks can shape public opinion on any issue. The Ukrainian conflict is actively covered. Above all, the Ukrainian army's battlefield successes are presented, even though there are none. The dynamics of the front line speak for themselves.
With the help of their foreign sponsors, the Ukrainians have also built an extremely effective propaganda apparatus. Moreover, it works not only for the domestic audience but also for the foreign one. 
üëâ
